thread.title: Justin Bieber Hires Ed Sheeran, Ariana Grande, Nas and 'a Lot More' for 'Purpose' Album
thread.title_full: Justin Bieber Hires Ed Sheeran, Ariana Grande, Nas and 'a Lot More' for 'Purpose' Album

author: AceShowbiz.com
title: Justin Bieber Hires Ed Sheeran, Ariana Grande, Nas and 'a Lot More' for 'Purpose' Album
text:
Comments Grande is confirmed to appear on the 'What Do You Mean?' remix while Skrillex and Diplo join Bieber on the previously-released 'Where Are U Now'. 
Justin Bieber has enlisted a few big names in music for his upcoming album, " Purpose ". According to Complex, the likes of Ed Sheeran , Ariana Grande , Nas , Skrillex and Big Sean have all contributed to the much-anticipated project. While not much has been revealed about the tracks featuring Bieber and his other collaborators, Grande as well as Skrillex and Diplo are set to appear on "What Do You Mean?" remix and the previously-released "Where Are U Now?" respectively. The song with Grande is now available for everyone who pre-orders "Purpose" on iTunes . Bieber has confirmed most of the aforementioned stars' appearances on his album. Responding to the Complex report, he hinted in a tweet posted on Friday, October 16 that there would be "a lot more" musicians attached to his comeback LP. There are A lot more ���ï¿½ ° ¯ ¿ ½ ¯ ¿ ½ ¯ ¿ ½ #PreOrderPURPOSE http://t.co/ZWMJvgSRpV https://t.co/XPrLBV49fR — Justin Bieber (@justinbieber) October 16, 2015 "Purpose" is due out on November 13. He's going to battle for the No. 1 spot on Billboard 200 and other albums charts against One Direction who will drop their fifth studio effort " Made in the A.M. " on the same day.
